intro: Crinum darienense, commonly known as the Darien crinum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in summer. The plant features strap-like, narrow leaves that form a rosette at the base, and it produces tall, erect stems with clusters of white or pinkish flowers. Crinum darienense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. It is also noted for its ability to thrive in humid, tropical environments.
